dcterms:creator: A. Uthamacumaran
S. Elouatik
M. Abdouh
M. Berteau-Rainville
Z-H. Gao
G. Arena
dcterms:description: Blood samples-derived extracellular vesicles (EVs) were isolated from 15 cancer patients and 9 healthy controls, labeled with PKH67 dye, and analyzed using fluorescence correlation spectroscopy (FCS) to distinguish cancer spectra from healthy control spectra.
dcterms:title: Blood samples-derived EVs

dcterms:creator: A. Uthamacumaran
S. Elouatik
M. Abdouh
M. Berteau-Rainville
Z-H. Gao
G. Arena
dcterms:description: FCS power spectra were generated from the fluorescence intensity fluctuations of the labeled EVs, processed using Fast-Fourier Transform to distinguish between cancer and healthy control samples.
dcterms:title: FCS power spectra

dcterms:creator: A. Uthamacumaran
S. Elouatik
M. Abdouh
M. Berteau-Rainville
Z-H. Gao
G. Arena
dcterms:description: Power spectral images were derived from the FCS power spectra and used for classification tasks via machine learning algorithms to differentiate between cancer and healthy control samples.
dcterms:title: Power spectral images

dcterms:creator: A. Uthamacumaran
S. Elouatik
M. Abdouh
M. Berteau-Rainville
Z-H. Gao
G. Arena
dcterms:description: Cancer patient-derived extracellular vesicles (EVs) were analyzed to assess their spectral characteristics and distinguish them from healthy control-derived EVs using machine learning techniques.
dcterms:title: Cancer patient-derived EVs

dcterms:creator: A. Uthamacumaran
S. Elouatik
M. Abdouh
M. Berteau-Rainville
Z-H. Gao
G. Arena
dcterms:description: Healthy control-derived extracellular vesicles (EVs) were used as a comparative group in the study to distinguish their spectral characteristics from those of cancer patient-derived EVs.
dcterms:title: Healthy control-derived EVs
